a:5:{s:39:"podlove-podcasting-plugin-for-wordpress";a:28:{s:4:"name";s:25:"Podlove Podcast Publisher";s:4:"slug";s:39:"podlove-podcasting-plugin-for-wordpress";s:7:"version";s:5:"3.6.1";s:6:"author";s:40:"<a href="http://podlove.org">Podlove</a>";s:14:"author_profile";s:40:"https://profiles.wordpress.org/eteubert/";s:8:"requires";s:5:"4.9.6";s:6:"tested";s:5:"5.8.2";s:12:"requires_php";s:3:"7.0";s:6:"rating";i:90;s:7:"ratings";a:5:{i:5;i:33;i:4;i:1;i:3;i:1;i:2;i:0;i:1;i:4;}s:11:"num_ratings";i:39;s:15:"support_threads";i:1;s:24:"support_threads_resolved";i:0;s:10:"downloaded";i:293131;s:12:"last_updated";s:21:"2021-09-20 6:13pm GMT";s:5:"added";s:10:"2012-06-26";s:8:"homepage";s:28:"http://publisher.podlove.org";s:8:"sections";a:5:{s:11:"description";s:3522:"<p>We built the Podlove Podcast Publisher because existing solutions are stuck in the past, complex and unwieldy. The Publisher helps you save time, worry less and provides a cutting edge listening experience for your audience.</p>
<p>Official Site: <a href="http://publisher.podlove.org/" rel="nofollow ugc">publisher.podlove.org</a></p>
<h4>Video Tutorial: Getting started with Podlove Publisher</h4>
<span class="embed-youtube" style="text-align:center; display: block;"><iframe class="youtube-player" width="640" height="360" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/Hmrm-jUe6u4?version=3&#038;rel=1&#038;showsearch=0&#038;showinfo=1&#038;iv_load_policy=1&#038;fs=1&#038;hl=en-US&#038;autohide=2&#038;wmode=transparent" allowfullscreen="true" style="border:0;" sandbox="allow-scripts allow-same-origin allow-popups allow-presentation"></iframe></span>
<h4>Compatible Feeds</h4>
<p>The Publisher makes it easy to create highly expressive, efficient and super compatible podcast feeds with fine grained control over client behavior (e.g. GUID control to replace faulty episodes and for clients to reload) supporting all important meta data.</p>
<h4>Multi-Format Publishing</h4>
<p>The Publisher also makes multi-format publishing &#8211; embracing all modern and legacy audio and video codecs &#8211; a snap. By adopting simple file name conventions, the plugin allows the podcaster to provide individual feeds for certain use cases or audiences without adding work for the podcaster during the publishing process.</p>
<h4>Optimized Web Player</h4>
<p>The Publisher also comes with integrated with the Podlove Web Player plugin (which you do not need to install separately) and fully support its advanced options including multiple audio (MP4 AAC, MP3, Vorbis, Opus) and video (MP4 H.264, WebM, Theora) format support for web browsers. This Web Player is fully HTML5 compatible (but provides Flash fallback for ancient environments) and is ready for all touch based clients too.</p>
<h4>Chapter Support</h4>
<p>The Publisher also makes it easy to publish chapter information in the player to make access to structured episodes even easier. Full support for linking directly to any part of your podcast on the web with instant playback included.</p>
<h4>Flexible Templates</h4>
<p>To round it all up, a flexible template system enables you to published Podcasts in a defined fashion and change the style at any time without having to touch your individual postings later on.</p>
<p>And this is just the beginning. We have a rich roadmap that will bring even more interesting features: integration with helpful services, much improved timeline metadata support (show notes) and much more.</p>
<h4>Further Reading</h4>
<ul>
<li><a href="http://publisher.podlove.org/" rel="nofollow ugc">Podlove Publisher</a></li>
<li><a href="http://podlove.org/" rel="nofollow ugc">Podlove Project</a></li>
<li><a href="https://community.podlove.org/" rel="nofollow ugc">Podlove Community</a></li>
<li><a href="http://docs.podlove.org/" rel="nofollow ugc">Documentation</a></li>
<li><a href="https://github.com/podlove/podlove-publisher/issues" rel="nofollow ugc">Bug Tracker</a></li>
<li><a href="http://podlove.org/donations/" rel="nofollow ugc">Donate</a></li>
</ul>
<p>Development of the plugin is an open process. The current version is available <a href="https://github.com/podlove/podlove-publisher" rel="nofollow ugc">on GitHub</a> Feel free to contribute and to fix errors or send improvements via GitHub.</p>
<p>Requires PHP 5.4+</p>
";s:12:"installation";s:410:"<ol>
<li>Download the Podlove Publisher Plugin to your desktop.</li>
<li>If downloaded as a zip archive, extract the Plugin folder to your desktop.</li>
<li>With your FTP program, upload the Plugin folder to the wp-content/plugins folder in your WordPress directory online.</li>
<li>Go to Plugins screen and find the newly uploaded Plugin in the list.</li>
<li>Click Activate Plugin to activate it.</li>
</ol>
";s:3:"faq";s:2320:"
<dt id='is%20podlove%20podcast%20publisher%20free%3F'>
Is Podlove Podcast Publisher free?
</h4>
<p>
<p>Yes! The core features of Podlove Podcast Publisher are and always will be free. <a href="https://publisher.podlove.org/support/" rel="nofollow ugc">Paid Professional Support</a> is available but not necessary to run the plugin.</p>
</p>
<dt id='are%20there%20download%20statistics%3F'>
Are there Download Statistics?
</h4>
<p>
<p>Yes! Podcast Downloads can be tracked and analyzed. You can easily see how many people downloaded you podcast episodes, which clients they used, if they prefer to subscribe to the feed or listen on your website using the web player‚Äîand much more.</p>
</p>
<dt id='are%20there%20privacy%20%2F%20gdpr%20considerations%3F'>
Are there Privacy / GDPR considerations?
</h4>
<p>
<p>Podlove Publisher is GDPR compliant and provides prewritten text snippets for your privacy page. See https://docs.podlove.org/podlove-publisher/guides/dsgvo-gdpr.html</p>
</p>
<dt id='where%20can%20i%20host%20my%20podcast%20files%3F'>
Where can I host my podcast files?
</h4>
<p>
<p>Any storage where you have control over the file naming is compatible with Podlove Podcast Publisher. You can manage files using a simple FTP/sFTP or use services like Amazon S3.</p>
</p>
<dt id='where%20can%20i%20ask%20questions%20and%20get%20support%3F'>
Where can I ask questions and get support?
</h4>
<p>
<p>Free support where questions are answered by the community is available in the <a href="http://community.podlove.org/" rel="nofollow ugc">Podlove Community Forum</a>. There is a German community in the <a href="https://sendegate.de/" rel="nofollow ugc">Sendegate</a>.</p>
</p>
<dt id='how%20can%20i%20help%20the%20project%3F'>
How can I help the project?
</h4>
<p>
<p>The continued success of Open Source project relies on the community. There are many ways you can help:</p>
<ul>
<li>If you enjoy the plugin, please <a href="https://wordpress.org/support/plugin/podlove-podcasting-plugin-for-wordpress/reviews/#new-post">leave a review</a>.</li>
<li>You can answer questions of other fellow podcasters in the <a href="https://community.podlove.org/" rel="nofollow ugc">Podlove Community</a>.</li>
</ul>
<p>This product includes GeoLite2 data created by MaxMind, available from http://www.maxmind.com.</p>
</p>

";s:9:"changelog";s:18710:"<h4>3.6.1</h4>
<ul>
<li>fix: sql issue when creating the episode database tables</li>
</ul>
<h4>3.6.0</h4>
<p><strong>New Module: Soundbite</strong></p>
<p>Adds support for the <code>&lt;podcast:soundbite&gt;</code> RSS feed tag.<br />
The intended use includes episodes previews, discoverability, audiogram generation, episode highlights, etc.</p>
<p>Using this module you can specify an audio segment for each episode that can be read by for example audiogram generation services.</p>
<p><strong>New Module: WordPress File Upload</strong></p>
<p>If you are using WordPress Media as storage for your Podlove assets, this new<br />
module adds conveniences.</p>
<p>First, you define a <code>Upload subdirectory</code> for your Podlove assets. This overrides<br />
any WordPress settings, so for example you can safely enable the typical date/month<br />
structure for WordPress attachments and it will not affect your Podlove Uploads.</p>
<p>Then you can update your &#8220;Podlove &#8211; Media &#8211; Upload Location&#8221; setting. You can keep<br />
it empty to let Podlove Publisher take care of it, or set it yourself if you have<br />
a custom file hostname.</p>
<p>Now there is an &#8220;Upload Media File&#8221; button in your episode form above<br />
the &#8220;Episode Media File Slug&#8221; where you can directly upload your files.<br />
If you are using multiple assets, you can upload them all there. Just make sure<br />
they all have the same filename (except the file extension) before you upload.</p>
<h4>3.5.5, 3.5.6</h4>
<p><strong>Fixes</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>SECURITY: sql injection in &#8220;Social &amp; Donations&#8221; module</li>
<li>transcript API returns list again</li>
<li>PLUS open graph images (use new API)</li>
<li>handle webvtt voice, missing Contributors</li>
<li>related episodes: remove whitespace in shortcode HTML to fix rendering in Spotify</li>
</ul>
<p><strong>Changes</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>webvtt transcripts use public contributor name</li>
<li>transcript voices / contributors:
<ul>
<li>you can now select &#8220;none&#8221; in the voice assignment</li>
<li>only voices with an assigned contributor (and not &#8220;none&#8221;) appear in public transcripts</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>generate default copyright claim if it is not explcitly set</li>
</ul>
<h4>3.5.4</h4>
<ul>
<li>adds copyright field in &#8220;Podcast Settings &#8211; Directory&#8221;, which is apparently required by the Apple Podcast Directory since yesterday.</li>
<li>perf: remove frontend.js (inline logic to download button HTML)</li>
</ul>
<h4>3.5.2 / 3.5.3</h4>
<p>This releases reverses all changes to Permalinks in releases 3.5.0 and 3.5.1.</p>
<p>I severely underestimated the effect these changes would have and revert all changes until I find a better solution. It‚Äôs simply not acceptable to change episode URLs, especially without an option for automatic redirects.</p>
<p>Please verify your episode URLs and the two expert settings ‚ÄúPermalink structure for episodes‚Äù and ‚ÄúEpisode Pages‚Äù.</p>
<p>What to do if you have used the ‚ÄúPODLOVE_ENABLE_PERMALINK_MAGIC‚Äù constant? It has no effect any more and you can safely remove it from your config file.</p>
<p>What happened to the ‚ÄúSimple Episode Permalink‚Äù setting from release 3.5.1? It has been removed, too.</p>
<p>Sorry for the trouble.<br />
Happy podcasting üôÇ</p>
<p><strong>Other</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>fix: remove usage of PHP 7.1 syntax in one file</li>
</ul>
<h4>3.5.1</h4>
<h4>2021-04-14</h4>
<ul>
<li>add: expert setting to make episode permalinks <code>/%postname%/</code></li>
<li>add: include Publisher Database Version in system report</li>
<li>drop WordPress version requirement to 4.9.6</li>
</ul>
<h4>3.5.0</h4>
<p><strong>Breaking Change</strong></p>
<p>Removes two expert settings:</p>
<ul>
<li>&#8220;Permalink structure for episodes&#8221; and</li>
<li>&#8220;Episode pages&#8221;</li>
</ul>
<p>These settings allowed to define custom URL structures for episodes and the episode archive.<br />
However they have caused trouble for a long time (see <a href="https://github.com/podlove/podlove-publisher/issues/1038" rel="nofollow ugc">#1038</a>)<br />
and the only viable way out seems to remove them.</p>
<p>How does that affect you?</p>
<p>If you have never touched these settings, feel free to shrug, smile and move on.</p>
<p>If you <em>are</em> using these settings, I encourage you to consider not using them as they are mostly of cosmetic nature.<br />
Should you however prefer to keep everything as is (including the known bugs of erratically broken permalinks / URLs), you can<br />
enable the settings back with a single line of code in your wp-config.php:</p>
<pre><code>    define('PODLOVE_ENABLE_PERMALINK_MAGIC', true);
</code></pre>
<p><strong>Experimental: Full-Page Podlove Templates</strong></p>
<p>If you want to create a 100% custom page based on an episode but without all the WordPress theme around, this is for you.<br />
Possible use case: A dedicated page to print the episode transcript.</p>
<ol>
<li>create a new Podlove Template, for example <code>page-episode-transcipt</code></li>
<li>Write that transcript as a <em>full HTML page</em>. That means it starts with <code>&lt;!doctype html&gt;&lt;html&gt;</code> and ends with <code>&lt;/html&gt;</code>!</li>
<li>Append <code>?podlove_template_page=page-episode-transcipt</code> to your public episode URL. For example if your episode is <code>https://example.com/ep001/</code>, then open <code>https://example.com/ep001/?podlove_template_page=page-episode-transcipt</code></li>
</ol>
<p>Very simple example template:</p>
<pre><code>&lt;!doctype html&gt;
&lt;html&gt;

&lt;head&gt;
  &lt;meta charset="utf-8"&gt;
  &lt;title&gt;Transcript | {{ episode.title }} | {{ podcast.title }}&lt;/title&gt;
  &lt;meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1"&gt;
&lt;/head&gt;

&lt;body&gt;

  &lt;p&gt;
    Here's the transcript for podcast &lt;strong&gt;{{ podcast.title }}&lt;/strong&gt; episode &lt;strong&gt;{{ episode.title }}&lt;/strong&gt;:
  &lt;/p&gt;

  [podlove-transcript]

&lt;/body&gt;

&lt;/html&gt;
</code></pre>
<p>Enjoy!</p>
<p><strong>Shownotes Module</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>provide website screenshot as fallback when no sharing image is available (requires PLUS token)</li>
<li>show images</li>
<li>show image in edit view</li>
<li>when importing, show all entries</li>
<li>show import progress when unfurling</li>
<li>fix osf importer</li>
<li>fix encoding issue when importing from HTML</li>
</ul>
<p><strong>Miscellaneous</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>update database for podcast user agents &#8212; notably includes classification of Apple Watch downloads as bot <a href="https://github.com/podlove/podlove-publisher/issues/1203" rel="nofollow ugc">#1203</a></li>
<li>transcript: add some basic info about podcast and episode into webvtt as a note</li>
<li>analytics: add hook <code>podlove_useragent_opawg_data</code> to add custom user agent detection</li>
<li>Podlove Templates: add <code>dataUri</code> method to images. Takes same arguments as <code>url</code> but returns a data uri. Useful if you want to generate a self-contained HTML page. If you&#8217;re not sure, better use <code>url</code>.</li>
<li>fix: transcripts with trailing newlines don&#8217;t confuse the importer</li>
<li>fix: don&#8217;t count contributors multiple times if they have multiple contributions in an episode (<a href="https://github.com/podlove/podlove-publisher/issues/1200" rel="nofollow ugc">#1200</a>)</li>
<li>fix: calling wptexturize too early (<a href="https://github.com/podlove/podlove-publisher/issues/1194" rel="nofollow ugc">#1194</a>)</li>
</ul>
<h4>3.4.1</h4>
<ul>
<li>fix: analytics shows section now does not include other taxonomies</li>
<li>use image caching for shownotes images</li>
<li>analytics shows section is now ordered by downloads</li>
</ul>
<h4>3.4.0</h4>
<p><strong>podcastindex namespace</strong></p>
<p>Both additions add metadata to the feed automatically if the data is present. No new user interfaces or data entry is necessary.</p>
<ul>
<li>add support for feed tag <a href="https://github.com/Podcastindex-org/podcast-namespace/blob/main/docs/1.0.md#transcript" rel="nofollow ugc"><code>podcast:transcript</code></a>, linking to the transcript in various formats (json, webvtt, xml)</li>
<li>add support for feed tag <a href="https://github.com/Podcastindex-org/podcast-namespace/blob/main/docs/1.0.md#person" rel="nofollow ugc"><code>podcast:person</code></a> on episode level</li>
</ul>
<p><strong>analytics</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>for selected date range, total downloads are shown</li>
<li>for selected date range, display downloads per show (only visible when shows module is enabled)</li>
</ul>
<h4>3.3.2</h4>
<ul>
<li>fix: in analytics, the &#8220;Export as CSV&#8221; section is now clickable when global statistics are loading or have no data</li>
<li>fix: &#8220;Export as CSV&#8221; works again</li>
<li>fix: &#8220;global statistics&#8221; charts idling indefinitely until a custom date range is chosen</li>
</ul>
<h4>3.3.0 / 3.3.1</h4>
<ul>

<li>unfurl uses https://plus.podlove.org/api/unfurl as API endpoint</li>
<li>add banner linking to donations page (can be dismissed)</li>
<li>shownotes:
<ul>
<li>add shortcode <code>[podlove-episode-shownotes]</code></li>
<li>display links even if unfurling failed</li>

<li>polished failure section UI and allow editing original URL</li>
<li>API: add missing permission callbacks</li>
<li>fix: keep order when importing via slacknotes</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>slacknotes: update to new API</li>
<li>change donation URL to https://opencollective.com/podlove</li>
<li>fix: handle missing templates in TwigLoaderPodloveDatabase</li>
</ul>

</ul>

<h4>3.1.0</h4>
<ul>
<li>analytics: new chart showing download development from episode to episode <a href="https://github.com/podlove/podlove-publisher/pull/1100/files" rel="nofollow ugc">#1100</a> thanks <a href="https://github.com/poschi3" rel="nofollow ugc">@poschi3</a>!</li>

<li>download tracking: use OPAWG podcast user agent database in addition to Matomo database</li>
<li>stability: detect plugins using older/incompatible versions of Twig. Display a warning on the site (instead of an error) and a detailed explanation on &#8220;Podlove &gt; Support&#8221; screen.</li>
<li>enhance: podcast file validation in dashboard includes all post stati and checks for missing slug <a href="https://github.com/podlove/podlove-publisher/pull/1161" rel="nofollow ugc">#1161</a></li>
<li>enhance: only allow episode numbers of 0 and higher in form input <a href="https://github.com/podlove/podlove-publisher/pull/1158" rel="nofollow ugc">#1158</a></li>
<li>api: add public endpoint for transcripts</li>
<li>api: add public endpoint for shownotes</li>
<li>fix: Podlove Web Player 5 includes all downloadable assets in download section</li>

<li>fix: migration for Shownotes only when the database table exists</li>
</ul>

<h4>3.0.1</h4>
<ul>
<li>fix: escaping issue in RSS feed (itunes:author and itunes:owner)</li>
<li>fix: remove (rare) accidental double enclosure tag in RSS feed when &#8220;enclosure&#8221; post meta is present</li>
</ul>
<h4>3.0.0</h4>
<p><strong>Breaking Changes</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>requires PHP 7.0 (or newer)</li>
<li>requires WordPress 5.2 (or newer)</li>
<li>Web Player:
<ul>
<li>removes Podlove Web Player 2</li>
<li>removes Podlove Web Player 3</li>
<li>removes &#8220;insert player automatically&#8221; option (probably does not affect anyone as the web player is by default inserted via template)</li>
<li>removes &#8220;Chapters Visibility&#8221; option (use dedicated Web Player settings instead)</li>
</ul>
</li>
</ul>
<p><strong>New Publisher PLUS</strong></p>
<p>=&gt; <a href="https://plus.podlove.org/" rel="nofollow ugc">plus.podlove.org</a></p>
<p>Publisher PLUS is a new service providing Feed Proxy and Podcast Subscriber statistics for Podlove Publisher.</p>
<p>To use it, enable the <em>Publisher PLUS</em> module, then visit <a href="https://plus.podlove.org/" rel="nofollow ugc">plus.podlove.org</a> to create an account.</p>
<p>Subscriber Statistics are only the beginning. Expect more features soon!</p>
<p><strong>Experimental: Shownotes</strong></p>
<p>Generate and manage episode show notes. Helps you provide rich metadata for URLs. Full support for Publisher Templates.</p>
<p>This module is a work-in-progress. But it&#8217;s usable, so feel free to give it a try, especially if your shownotes are link-heavy and you&#8217;re comfortable writing Podlove (Twig) templates.</p>
<p>The module is currently hidden. Make it visible by setting a PHP constant, for example in your <code>wp-config.php</code>: <code>define('PODLOVE_MODULE_SHOWNOTES_VISBLE', true);</code>.</p>
<p>Use this template as a starting point: https://gist.github.com/eteubert/d6c51c52372dc2da2f1734a5f54c7918</p>
<p><strong>Shortcodes</strong></p>
<ul>
<li><code>podlove-episode-contributor-list</code>
<ul>
<li>new design</li>
<li>renders text-only in RSS feed</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li><code>podlove-podcast-contributor-list</code>
<ul>
<li>new design</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li><code>podlove-episode-downloads</code>
<ul>
<li>the text link variant is now the default style</li>
</ul>
</li>
</ul>
<p><strong>Miscellaneous</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>remove Bitlove module (service does not exist any more)</li>
<li>remove Flattr module</li>
<li>remove &#8220;Website Protocol&#8221; setting (not necessary any more as Let&#8217;s Encrypt is widely supported)</li>
<li>enable episode chapters by default</li>
<li>convenience: &#8220;Copy to Clipboard&#8221; function for Podlove Template shortcodes</li>
<li>expose iTunes id/URL in podcast feed (<a href="https://github.com/podlove/podlove-publisher/pull/1078" rel="nofollow ugc">#1078</a>)</li>
<li>improve feed rendering: use XML generator for all tags with user input to guarantee valid feeds for all inputs</li>
<li>add function to remove a transcript from an episode (<a href="https://github.com/podlove/podlove-publisher/issues/1131" rel="nofollow ugc">#1131</a>)</li>
<li>add Steady as donation service</li>
<li>add template tag: <code>episode.post_title</code> (<a href="https://github.com/podlove/podlove-publisher/issues/1136" rel="nofollow ugc">#1136</a>)</li>
<li>add template tag: <code>service.type</code> (https://community.podlove.org/t/replacing-social-icons/2321)</li>
<li>add default avatar to transcript preview</li>
<li>fix: search logic (<a href="https://github.com/podlove/podlove-publisher/issues/1072" rel="nofollow ugc">#1072</a>)</li>
<li>fix: fetch Podlove News via https (<a href="https://github.com/podlove/podlove-publisher/issues/1037" rel="nofollow ugc">#1037</a>)</li>
<li>fix: don&#8217;t send Publisher logs to system log when WP_DEBUG is on (<a href="https://github.com/podlove/podlove-publisher/issues/1065" rel="nofollow ugc">#1065</a>)</li>
<li>fix: ensure uploads for webvtt (transcripts) and gz (exports) are allowed</li>
<li>fix: ensure contributors module is active when transcripts are used</li>
<li>fix: ensure permissions in shownotes and transcripts APIs</li>
<li>fix: don&#8217;t count download requests with http range header of <code>bytes=0-0</code> (<a href="https://github.com/podlove/podlove-publisher/issues/1135" rel="nofollow ugc">#1135</a>)</li>
<li>update dependencies</li>
<li>build releases with GitHub Actions (in favour of TravisCI)</li>
</ul>
<p>Changes for previous versions can be found in the <a href="https://github.com/podlove/podlove-publisher/blob/master/changelog.txt" rel="nofollow ugc"><code>changelog.txt</code></a>.</p>

/podlove-podcasting-plugin-for-wordpress/assets/icon.svg?rev=1545024";s:2:"2x";s:92:"https://ps.w.org/podlove-podcasting-plugin-for-wordpress/assets/icon-256x256.png?rev=1545024";s:3:"svg";s:84:"https://ps.w.org/podlove-podcasting-plugin-for-wordpress/assets/icon.svg?rev=1545024";}s:12:"contributors";a:0:{}s:6:"market";N;s:11:"custom_link";N;}s:18:"podlove-web-player";a:28:{s:4:"name";s:18:"Podlove Web Player";s:4:"slug";s:18:"podlove-web-player";s:7:"version";s:6:"5.4.15";s:6:"author";s:40:"<a href="http://podlove.org">Podlove</a>";s:14:"author_profile";s:46:"https://profiles.wordpress.org/gerritvanaaken/";s:8:"requires";s:5:"4.9.6";s:6:"tested";s:5:"5.8.2";s:12:"requires_php";s:3:"7.2";s:6:"rating";i:70;s:7:"ratings";a:5:{i:5;i:7;i:4;i:0;i:3;i:1;i:2;i:0;i:1;i:4;}s:11:"num_ratings";i:12;s:15:"support_threads";i:1;s:24:"support_threads_resolved";i:0;s:10:"downloaded";i:109404;s:12:"last_updated";s:21:"2021-12-11 3:54pm GMT";s:5:"added";s:10:"2012-07-03";s:8:"homepage";s:44:"https://docs.podlove.org/podlove-web-player/";s:8:"sections";a:4:{s:11:"description";s:2880:"<p>Podlove Web Player is a HTML5 based web player for audio and video media files that is optimized and extended for the specific needs of podcasters.<br />
It has a native integration with <a href="https://wordpress.org/plugins/podlove-podcasting-plugin-for-wordpress/">Podlove Publisher</a>, can be used as a shortcode and also plays well with Gutenberg Blocks.</p>
<h3>Made for Podcasters</h3>
<ul>
<li>Podcast Chapters</li>
<li>Transcripts</li>
<li>Sharing &amp; Embedding</li>
<li>Download integrated</li>
<li>Audio Controls, including playback speed</li>
<li>Supports multiple audio file formats</li>
<li>Supports live streams</li>
</ul>
<h3>Theming &amp; Templating</h3>
<p>The Player is fully customizable in terms of</p>
<ul>
<li>Theme colors</li>
<li>Font family and weight</li>
<li>Templates and appearance</li>
</ul>
<h3>Subscribe Button Integration</h3>
<ul>
<li>Customizable Podcast Clients</li>
<li>Integration in the Player</li>
</ul>
<h3>Usage</h3>
<p>There are basically four ways to use the Podlove Web Player:</p>
<h4>1 Manual WordPress Shortcode</h4>
<p>Use a simple shortcode in your posts and pages, and the Podlove Web Player will appear, playing any media file you want to assign. Basic usage:</p>
<pre><code>[podlove-web-player
  theme="default"
  config="default"
  title="My episode title"
  subtitle="Episode Subtitle"
  poster="/files/path/to/poster.png"
  chapters="/files/path/to/chapters.json"
  transcripts="/files/path/to/transcripts.json"
  playlist="/files/path/to/playlist.json"
  src="http://mysite.com/mymedia.mp3"
  size="1337"
  show="My show title"
  duration="03:33"
]
</code></pre>
<p>Use an existing post with a media enclosure that is provided from plugins like Blubrry:</p>
<pre><code>[podlove-web-player
  theme="default"
  config="default"
  post="1234"
]
</code></pre>
<p>Or in case you have our <a href="https://wordpress.org/plugins/podlove-podcasting-plugin-for-wordpress/">Podlove Publisher</a> installed:</p>
<pre><code>[podlove-web-player
  theme="default"
  config="default"
  publisher="1234"
]
</code></pre>
<h4>2 Using WordPress Gutenberg Blocks</h4>
<p>You can choose between different references, like Podlove Publisher, Blocks or you can add the meta data manually. Right now the latter option is limited to a limited set of attributes, this will be expanded in further releases.</p>
<h4>3 Automatic Integration with Podcasting Engines</h4>
<p>If you are using Podlove Publisher you should be able to select it in the Publisher Player settings.<br />
In case you are still using Blubrry you can simply enable the automatic insertions on enclosures in the settings and choose the position.</p>
<h3>Help &amp; Support</h3>
<p>If you encounter any issue with the plugin or want to request a specific feature please reach out to our <a href="https://community.podlove.org/" rel="nofollow ugc">Podlove Community</a>.</p>
";s:12:"installation";s:411:"<ol>
<li>Download the Podlove Web Player Plugin to your desktop.</li>
<li>If downloaded as a zip archive, extract the Plugin folder to your desktop.</li>
<li>With your FTP program, upload the Plugin folder to the wp-content/plugins folder in your WordPress directory online.</li>
<li>Go to Plugins screen and find the newly uploaded Plugin in the list.</li>
<li>Click Activate Plugin to activate it.</li>
</ol>
";s:9:"changelog";s:11327:"<h4>5.4.15</h4>
<ul>
<li>Update to Podlove Web Player 5.7.4</li>
<li>Update WordPress compatability</li>
</ul>
<h4>5.4.14</h4>
<ul>
<li>Update to Podlove Web Player 5.7.2</li>
</ul>
<h4>5.4.13</h4>
<ul>
<li>Update to Podlove Web Player 5.5.0</li>
<li>Fixes warnings because of incomplete data structures</li>
</ul>
<h4>5.4.12</h4>
<ul>
<li>Add ClassicPress interoperability</li>
<li>Drop minimal requirement to 4.9.6</li>
</ul>
<h4>5.4.11</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fix an issue that could lead to invisible player</li>
</ul>
<h4>5.4.10</h4>
<ul>
<li>Update wordpress repository</li>
</ul>
<h4>5.4.9</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fix PHP warnings for array_replace and array_merge</li>
<li>Add logic to hide player while it&#8217;s initializing</li>
<li>Improve README</li>
</ul>
<h4>5.4.8</h4>
<ul>
<li>Remove conditonal loading due to WordPress quirkyness :/</li>
</ul>
<h4>5.4.7</h4>
<ul>
<li>Improve page performance by only adding scripts on pages with a player</li>
<li>Harden lifecycle, only render player once all scripts are available (this may lead to slower page rendering)</li>
</ul>
<h4>5.4.5</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fix PHP warnings</li>
<li>Minimize cache.js size</li>
<li>Only add api requests to cache</li>
</ul>
<h4>5.4.4</h4>
<ul>
<li>Brings back show tag for shortcode</li>
<li>Fixes shortcode registration</li>
</ul>
<h4>5.4.3</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fixes an issue with persisting embed player and share playtime config</li>
<li>Fixes an issue with rendering the player enclosure in feed</li>
</ul>
<h4>5.4.2</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fixes an issue with persisting the embedding settings</li>
<li>Improves compatability if the plugin is activated but not enabled in the Podlove Publisher settings</li>
</ul>
<h4>5.4.1</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fixes issue with active default tab</li>
<li>Fixes an issue with invalid stored configurations</li>
</ul>
<h4>5.4.0</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fix issues with default configuration saving</li>
<li>Fix menu highlighting</li>
<li>Add assistive texts to theming</li>
<li>Feature add ability to define related episodes</li>
<li>Improve player loading and caching performance</li>
<li>Update Podlove Web Player to v5.3.1</li>
<li>Breaking: removes ability to define a show as a related episode in the publisher player template</li>
</ul>
<h4>5.3.1</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fix API requests to make configurator working again</li>
</ul>
<h4>5.3.0</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fix API warnings</li>
<li>Update Podlove Web Player to v5.3.0</li>
</ul>

href="https://podlove.org">Podlove</a>";s:14:"author_profile";s:40:"https://profiles.wordpress.org/chemiker/";s:8:"requires";s:5:"3.5.0";s:6:"tested";s:6:"5.3.10";s:12:"requires_php";s:3:"5.3";s:6:"rating";i:100;s:7:"ratings";a:5:{i:5;i:2;i:4;i:0;i:3;i:0;i:2;i:0;i:1;i:0;}s:11:"num_ratings";i:2;s:15:"support_threads";i:1;s:24:"support_threads_resolved";i:0;s:10:"downloaded";i:29211;s:12:"last_updated";s:22:"2019-10-31 10:24pm GMT";s:5:"added";s:10:"2015-04-15";s:8:"homepage";s:62:"https://wordpress.org/extend/plugins/podlove-subscribe-button/";s:8:"sections";a:5:{s:11:"description";s:2037:"<p>This plugin allows easy inclusion of the Podlove Subscribe Button. Put it in your sidebar with a simple widget or include the button in pages and/or posts with a simple shortcode.</p>
<h3>About the Podlove Subscribe Button</h3>
<p>The Podlove Subscribe Button allows for simple subscription of podcasts in anybody&#8217;s favorite podcast app right from the browser without having to deal with pesky feed URLs and go on a hunt for feed subscription dialogues.</p>
<p>The button knows how to activate the subscription functionality in all popular podcast apps supporting various operating systems including but not limited to iOS, Android, WindowsPhone, OSX, Windows and Linux.</p>
<p>The button is centrally hosted and gets permanently updated when new podcast apps emerge or when new features are added. Using the button ensures your podcast can easily be subscribed to and presents an ever more popular user interface that your audience gets more and more used to.</p>
<h3>About Podlove</h3>
<p>Podlove is an open source initiative to improve the overall podcasting infrastructure and to come up with simple but helpful standards and tools to make publishing and listening to podcast as easy as possible.</p>
<p>Podlove currently provides:</p>
<ul>
<li><a href="https://publisher.podlove.org" rel="nofollow ugc"><strong><em>Podlove Podcast Publisher</em></strong></a> &#8211; a powerful plugin for WordPress for podcasters to publish metadata-rich podcasts</li>
<li><strong><em>Podlove Web Player</em></strong> &#8211; a podcast-optimized HTML5 web player with chapter support</li>
<li><a href="https://subscribe-button.podlove.org" rel="nofollow ugc"><strong><em>Podlove Subscribe Button</em></strong></a> &#8211; a centrally hosted universal podcast subscribe button for the web</li>
</ul>
<h3>Other Resources</h3>
<ul>
<li>Podlove Project: https://podlove.org/</li>
<li>Podlove Community: https://community.podlove.org/</li>
<li>Documentation: https://docs.podlove.org/</li>
<li>Donate: https://podlove.org/donations/</li>
</ul>
";s:12:"installation";s:4139:"<h3>Install the plugin</h3>
<ol>
<li>Upload the plugin folder to the <code>/wp-content/plugins/</code> directory</li>
<li>Activate the plugin through the &#8216;Plugins&#8217; menu in WordPress</li>
</ol>
<h3>Configure buttons</h3>
<ol>
<li>Navigate to <code>Settings &gt; Podlove Subscribe Button</code></li>
<li>Fill out all fields, save and grab the shortcode</li>
<li>Add the button to your blog using the shortcode <code>[podlove-subscribe-button id="{{yourButtonID}}"]</code> with your button ID, or use the provided Podlove Subscribe Button Widget</li>
</ol>
<h3>Display the Subscribe Button in your Sidebar using a Widget</h3>
<p>Go to <code>Appearance -&gt; Widgets</code> and drag the &#8220;Podlove Subscribe Button&#8221; widget to your sidebar configuration. Select the pre-configured button from the list and determine which style you want. That&#8217;s it. The button should show up in your sidebar. Optionally add a title and description for your widget.</p>
<p>This is the easiest and recommended way of using this plugin especially if you ony want to display a button for a single podcast. For best visibility choose size &#8220;big&#8221; and format &#8220;cover&#8221; to make your Subscribe Button stand out and easily locatable.</p>
<h3>Include the Subscribe Button in WordPress pages using a Shortcode</h3>
<p>If you want to include a Podlove Subscribe Button in a WordPress page (or a post) just put the shortcode <code>[podlove-subscribe-button]</code> at the desired position in your text. Use the following shortcode parameters to configure it properly:</p>
<ul>
<li><code>button</code> &#8211; the ID of one of your preconfigured buttons</li>
<li><code>size</code> &#8211; one of &#8216;small&#8217;, &#8216;medium&#8217;, &#8216;big&#8217;</li>
<li><code>width</code> &#8211; specify desired button width in CSS compatibles values or &#8216;auto&#8217; automatic width depending on context.</li>
<li><code>color</code> &#8211; specify the color of the button in a CSS compatible format (keyword, rgb-hex, rgb, rgba, hsl, hsla)</li>
<li><code>style</code> &#8211; default is filled, options are &#8216;outline&#8217; and &#8216;frameless&#8217;</li>
<li><code>format</code> &#8211; default is a rectangle, options are &#8216;square&#8217; and &#8216;cover&#8217; (<strong>Note</strong>: &#8216;cover&#8217; has a max size of 300px)</li>
<li><code>hide</code> &#8211; if set to <code>true</code> the button will not be shown (useful if you want to use your own element)</li>
<li><code>language</code> &#8211; specify the language the texts on the button and popup should be in (currently supports &#8216;de&#8217;, &#8216;en&#8217;, &#8216;eo&#8217;, &#8216;fi&#8217;, &#8216;fr&#8217;, &#8216;nl&#8217;, &#8216;zh&#8217; and &#8216;ja&#8217;)</li>
</ul>
<p>Note that if you do not provide one of the attributes the subscribe button will use the globally set default.</p>
<h3>Shortcode Examples</h3>
<pre><code>[podlove-subscribe-button button="mybutton1" size="big"]
</code></pre>
<p>Displays a large button with the podcast logo on top using data from button configuration with id &#8220;mybutton1&#8221;. All other options will be set to the globally set default values.</p>
<pre><code>[podlove-subscribe-button button="mybutton2" size="medium" width="100pt" language="de"]
</code></pre>
<p>Displays a small button with a width of 100pt using data from button configuration with id &#8220;mybutton2&#8221; in german. All other options will be set to the globally set default values.</p>
<pre><code>[podlove-subscribe-button button="mybutton3" size="big" width="auto" format="cover"]
</code></pre>
<p>Displays a big button with a the podcast cover and automatically adjusted using data from button configuration with id &#8220;mybutton3&#8221;. All other options will be set to the globally set default values.</p>
<pre><code>[podlove-subscribe-button button="mybutton4" format="square" style="frameless"]
</code></pre>
<p>Displays a small, frameless square button with using data from button configuration with id &#8220;mybutton4&#8221;. All other options will be set to the globally set default values.</p>
";s:3:"faq";s:1367:"
<h4>I&#8217;m running the Podlove Publisher. Do I need this plugin to display a Subscribe button?</h4>
<p>
<p>Yes and No. If you simply want to display a Subscribe Button for your Podcast you publish with the Podlove Publisher you do not need this plugin as the Publisher itself provides this functionality. If you want to display multiple Subscribe Buttons you can use the Subscribe Button plugin.</p>
</p>
<h4>Where do I create those &#8220;Network-wide&#8221; Buttons?</h4>
<p>
<p>You can find the Panel in the Networks Settings Section</p>
</p>
<h4>Does this plugin actually contain the code for the button?</h4>
<p>
<p>No. This plugin just embeds the code that is needed to display the Podlove Subscribe Button. The button itself is served live from api.podlove.org</p>
</p>
<h4>Do I update the plugin to get support for more clients?</h4>
<p>
<p>No. As the Podlove Subscribe Button is hosted centrally, it gets updated regularly independent from this pugin.</p>
</p>
<h4>I am a podcast app developer and would like my app be listed in the button. What do I need to do?</h4>
<p>
<p>Consult the information provided on <a href="https://podlove.org/podlove-subscribe-button" rel="nofollow ugc">the technical information page</a> at podlove.org on how the button works and what app developers need to support and do in order to get listed in the button.</p>
</p>

<ul>
<li>FIXED an issue that prevented the subscribe button to appear</li>

</ul>

Member ‚Äì User Profile, User Registration, Login &amp; Membership Plugin";s:4:"slug";s:15:"ultimate-member";s:7:"version";s:5:"2.3.0";s:6:"author";s:56:"<a href="http://ultimatemember.com/">Ultimate Member</a>";s:14:"author_profile";s:46:"https://profiles.wordpress.org/ultimatemember/";s:8:"requires";s:3:"5.0";s:6:"tested";s:5:"5.8.2";s:12:"requires_php";s:3:"5.6";s:6:"rating";i:88;s:7:"ratings";a:5:{i:5;i:1065;i:4;i:64;i:3;i:30;i:2;i:37;i:1;i:132;}s:11:"num_ratings";i:1328;s:15:"support_threads";i:349;s:24:"support_threads_resolved";i:285;s:10:"downloaded";i:5989554;s:12:"last_updated";s:21:"2021-12-20 8:49am GMT";s:5:"added";s:10:"2015-01-21";s:8:"homepage";s:26:"http://ultimatemember.com/";s:8:"sections";a:5:{s:11:"description";s:9623:"<h4>Best User Profile &amp; Membership Plugin for WordPress</h4>
<p>Ultimate Member is the #1 user profile &amp; membership plugin for WordPress. The plugin makes it a breeze for users to sign-up and become members of your website. The plugin allows you to add beautiful user profiles to your site and is perfect for creating advanced online communities and membership sites. Lightweight and highly extendible, Ultimate Member will enable you to create almost any type of site where users can join and become members with absolute ease.</p>
<h4>Features of the plugin include:</h4>
<ul>
<li>Front-end user profiles</li>
<li>Front-end user registration</li>
<li>Front-end user login</li>
<li>Custom form fields</li>
<li>Conditional logic for form fields</li>
<li>Drag and drop form builder</li>
<li>User account page</li>
<li>Custom user roles</li>
<li>Member directories</li>
<li>User emails</li>
<li>Content restriction</li>
<li>Conditional nav menus</li>
<li>Show author posts &amp; comments on user profiles</li>
<li>Developer friendly with dozens of actions and filters</li>
</ul>
<p>Read about all of the plugin&#8217;s features at <a href="https://ultimatemember.com" rel="nofollow ugc">Ultimate Member</a></p>
<h4>Paid Extensions</h4>
<p>Ultimate Member has a range of extensions that allow you to extend the power of the plugin. You can purchase all of these extensions at a significant discount with our <a href="https://ultimatemember.com/pricing/" rel="nofollow ugc">All Access Pass</a> or you can purchase extensions individually.</p>
<ul>
<li><a href="https://ultimatemember.com/extensions/user-notes/" rel="nofollow ugc">User Notes</a> &#8211; Allow users to create public and private notes from their profile</li>
<li><a href="https://ultimatemember.com/extensions/profile-tabs/" rel="nofollow ugc">Profile Tabs</a> &#8211; Allow to add the custom tabs to profiles</li>
<li><a href="https://ultimatemember.com/extensions/user-locations/" rel="nofollow ugc">User Locations</a> &#8211; Allow to display users on a map on the member directory page and allow users to add their location via their profile</li>
<li><a href="https://ultimatemember.com/extensions/unsplash/" rel="nofollow ugc">Unsplash</a> &#8211; Allow users to select a profile cover photo from <a href="https://unsplash.com/" rel="nofollow ugc">Unsplash</a> from their profile</li>
<li><a href="https://ultimatemember.com/extensions/user-bookmarks/" rel="nofollow ugc">User Bookmarks</a> &#8211; Allow users to bookmark content from your website</li>
<li><a href="https://ultimatemember.com/extensions/user-photos/" rel="nofollow ugc">User Photos</a> &#8211; Allow users to upload photos to their profile</li>
<li><a href="https://ultimatemember.com/extensions/groups/" rel="nofollow ugc">Groups</a> &#8211; Allow users to create and join groups around shared topics, interests etc.</li>
<li><a href="https://ultimatemember.com/extensions/private-content/" rel="nofollow ugc">Private Content</a> &#8211; Display private content to logged in users that only they can access</li>
<li><a href="https://ultimatemember.com/extensions/user-tags/" rel="nofollow ugc">User Tags</a> &#8211; Lets you add a user tag system to your website</li>
<li><a href="https://ultimatemember.com/extensions/social-activity/" rel="nofollow ugc">Social Activity</a> &#8211; Let users create public wall posts &amp; see the activity of other users</li>
<li><a href="https://ultimatemember.com/extensions/woocommerce/" rel="nofollow ugc">WooCommerce</a> &#8211; Allow you to integrate WooCommerce with Ultimate Member</li>
<li><a href="https://ultimatemember.com/extensions/private-messages/" rel="nofollow ugc">Private Messages</a> &#8211; Add a private messaging system to your site &amp; allow users to message each other</li>
<li><a href="https://ultimatemember.com/extensions/followers/" rel="nofollow ugc">Followers</a> &#8211; Allow users to follow each other on your site and protect their profile information</li>
<li><a href="https://ultimatemember.com/extensions/real-time-notifications/" rel="nofollow ugc">Real-time Notifications</a> &#8211; Add a notifications system to your site so users can receive real-time notifications</li>
<li><a href="https://ultimatemember.com/extensions/social-login/" rel="nofollow ugc">Social Login</a> &#8211; Let users register &amp; login to your site via Facebook, Twitter, G+, LinkedIn, Instagram and Vkontakte (VK.com)</li>
<li><a href="https://ultimatemember.com/extensions/bbpress/" rel="nofollow ugc">bbPress</a> &#8211; With the bbPress extension you can beautifully integrate Ultimate Member with bbPress</li>
<li><a href="https://ultimatemember.com/extensions/mailchimp/" rel="nofollow ugc">MailChimp</a> &#8211; Allow users to subscribe to your MailChimp lists when they signup on your site and sync user meta to MailChimp</li>
<li><a href="https://ultimatemember.com/extensions/user-reviews/" rel="nofollow ugc">User Reviews</a> &#8211; Allow users to rate &amp; review each other using a 5 star rate/review system</li>
<li><a href="https://ultimatemember.com/extensions/verified-users/" rel="nofollow ugc">Verified Users</a> &#8211; Add a user verification system to your site so user accounts can be verified</li>
<li><a href="https://ultimatemember.com/extensions/mycred/" rel="nofollow ugc">myCRED</a> &#8211; With the myCRED extension you can integrate Ultimate Member with the popular myCRED points management plugin</li>
<li><a href="https://ultimatemember.com/extensions/notices/" rel="nofollow ugc">Notices</a> &#8211; Alert users to important information using conditional notices</li>
<li><a href="https://ultimatemember.com/extensions/profile-completeness/" rel="nofollow ugc">Profile Completeness</a> &#8211; Encourage or force users to complete their profiles with the profile completeness extension</li>
<li><a href="https://ultimatemember.com/extensions/friends/" rel="nofollow ugc">Friends</a> &#8211; Allows users to become friends by sending &amp; accepting/rejecting friend requests</li>
</ul>
<h4>Free Extensions</h4>
<ul>
<li><a href="https://ultimatemember.com/extensions/jobboardwp/" rel="nofollow ugc">JobsBoardWP</a> &#8211; This free extension integrates Ultimate Member with the job board plugin <a href="https://wordpress.org/plugins/jobboardwp">JobBoardWP</a>.</li>
<li><a href="https://ultimatemember.com/extensions/forumwp/" rel="nofollow ugc">ForumWP</a> &#8211; This free extension integrates Ultimate Member with the forum plugin <a href="https://forumwpplugin.com" rel="nofollow ugc">ForumWP</a>.</li>
<li><a href="https://ultimatemember.com/extensions/terms-conditions/" rel="nofollow ugc">Terms &amp; Conditions</a> &#8211; Add a terms and condition checkbox to your registration forms &amp; require users to agree to your T&amp;Cs before registering on your site.</li>
<li><a href="https://ultimatemember.com/extensions/google-recaptcha/" rel="nofollow ugc">Google reCAPTCHA</a> &#8211; Stop bots on your registration &amp; login forms with Google reCAPTCHA</li>
<li><a href="https://ultimatemember.com/extensions/online-users/" rel="nofollow ugc">Online Users</a> &#8211; Display what users are online with this extension</li>
</ul>
<h4>Theme</h4>
<p>Our official <a href="https://ultimatemember.com/theme/" rel="nofollow ugc">theme</a> is purpose built for websites that have logged in and out users. The <a href="https://ultimatemember.com/theme/" rel="nofollow ugc">theme</a> has deep integration with Ultimate Member plugin and the extensions, different header designs for logged-in/out users and works alongside the Beaver Builder and Elementor page builders.</p>
<h4>Our other plugins</h4>
<p>In addition to Ultimate Member, we also have two other plugins: <a href="https://forumwpplugin.com/" rel="nofollow ugc">ForumWP</a> and <a href="https://wordpress.org/plugins/jobboardwp">JobBoardWP</a>.</p>
<h4>ForumWP</h4>
<p><a href="https://forumwpplugin.com/" rel="nofollow ugc">ForumWP</a> is a forum plugin which adds an online forum to your website, allowing users to create topics and write replies. Forums are a great way to build and grow an online community.</p>
<h4>JobBoardWP</h4>
<p><a href="https://wordpress.org/plugins/jobboardwp">JobBoardWP</a> is a job board plugin which adds a modern job board to your website. Display job listings and allow employers to submit and manage jobs all from the front-end.</p>
<h4>Development * Translations</h4>
<p>If you&#8217;re a developer and would like to contribute to the source code of the plugin you can do so via our <a href="https://github.com/ultimatemember/ultimatemember" rel="nofollow ugc">GitHub Repository</a>.</p>
<p>Want to add a new language to Ultimate Member? Great! You can contribute via <a href="https://translate.wordpress.org/projects/wp-plugins/ultimate-member" rel="nofollow ugc">translate.wordpress.org</a>.</p>
<p>If you are a developer and you need to know the list of UM Hooks, make this via our <a href="https://docs.ultimatemember.com/article/1324-hooks-list" rel="nofollow ugc">Hooks Documentation</a>.</p>
<p>If you are a developer and you need to know the structure of our code, make this via our <a href="https://ultimatemember.com/php-docs/" rel="nofollow ugc">Documentation API</a>.</p>
<h4>Documentation &amp; Support</h4>
<p>Got a problem or need help with Ultimate Member? Head over to our <a href="http://docs.ultimatemember.com/" rel="nofollow ugc">documentation</a> and perform a search of the knowledge base. If you can‚Äôt find a solution to your issue then you can create a topic on the <a href="https://wordpress.org/support/plugin/ultimate-member">support forum</a>.</p>
";s:12:"installation";s:268:"<ol>
<li>Activate the plugin</li>
<li>That&#8217;s it. Go to Ultimate Member &gt; Settings to customize plugin options</li>
<li>For more details, please visit the official <a href="http://docs.ultimatemember.com/" rel="nofollow ugc">Documentation</a> page.</li>
</ol>
";s:3:"faq";s:1614:"
<dt id='do%20i%20need%20to%20know%20any%20coding%20to%20use%20this%20plugin%3F'>
Do I need to know any coding to use this plugin?
</h4>
<p>
<p>No, we have built Ultimate Member to be extremely easy to use and does not require you to manually build shortcodes or have any coding knowledge.</p>
</p>
<dt id='is%20ultimate%20member%20mobile%20responsive%3F'>
Is Ultimate Member mobile responsive?
</h4>
<p>
<p>Yes. Ultimate Member is designed to adapt nicely to any screen resolution. It includes specific designs for phones, tablets and desktops.</p>
</p>
<dt id='is%20ultimate%20member%20multi-site%20compatible%3F'>
Is Ultimate Member multi-site compatible?
</h4>
<p>
<p>Yes. Ultimate Member works great on both single site and multi-site WordPress installs.</p>
</p>
<dt id='does%20the%20plugin%20work%20with%20any%20wordpress%20theme%3F'>
Does the plugin work with any WordPress theme?
</h4>
<p>
<p>Yes. Ultimate Member will work with any properly coded theme. However, some themes may cause conflicts with the plugin. If you find a styling issue with your theme please create a post in the community forum.</p>
</p>
<dt id='does%20the%20plugin%20work%20with%20caching%20plugins%3F'>
Does the plugin work with caching plugins?
</h4>
<p>
<p>The plugin works with popular caching plugins by automatically excluding Ultimate Member pages from being cached. This ensures other visitors to a page will not see the private information of another user. However, if you add features of Ultimate Member to other pages you have to exclude those pages from being cached through your cache plugin settings panel.</p>
</p>

";s:9:"changelog";s:131046:"<h4>Important:</h4>
<ul>
<li>To learn more about version 2.1 please see this <a href="https://docs.ultimatemember.com/article/1512-upgrade-2-1-0" rel="nofollow ugc">docs</a></li>
<li>UM2.1+ is a significant update to the Member Directories&#8217; code base from 2.0.x. Please make sure you take a full-site backup with restore point before updating the plugin</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.3.0: December 20, 2021</h4>
<ul>
<li>
<p>Enhancements:</p>
<ul>
<li>Added: WhatsApp, Telegram, Discord, Viber messengers predefined fields.</li>
<li>Added: Callback for deleting the custom field data from member direcroty settings when this custom field has been deleted in Form Builder.</li>
<li>Added: &#8216;um_account_active_tab_inited&#8217; JS hook.</li>
<li>Updated: Require a strong password option (<code>Ultimate Member &gt; Settings &gt; General &gt; Users &gt; Require a strong password?</code>) to make it common for all Ultimate Member forms. Renamed option key from <code>reset_require_strongpass</code> to <code>require_strongpass</code>.</li>
<li>Updated: Form errors texts on the login/password reset forms. Made them secure.</li>
<li>Deprecated: <code>Ultimate Member &gt; Settings &gt; General &gt; Account &gt; Require a strong password?</code> option and merged with <code>Ultimate Member &gt; Settings &gt; General &gt; Users &gt; Require a strong password?</code> option.</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>
<p>Bugfixes:</p>
<ul>
<li>Fixed: &#8220;Clear All&#8221; button for the filters with &#8220;&amp;&#8221; symbol in the label.</li>
<li>Fixed: Uninstall process when delete UM data. Avoid the issue when 3rd-party pages that had been selected as UM page are removed on UM uninstall.</li>
<li>Fixed: Header meta for the Twitter Card. If the user has twitter field filled then  will be filled by this value.</li>
<li>Fixed: Member directory a slider filter&#8217;s label displaying. It uses the filled label for now.</li>
<li>Fixed: SkypeID field validation. Also all SkypeID fields on your forms changed type from <code>url</code> to <code>text</code>. SkypeID supports nicknames or https://join.skype.com/{hash} links.</li>
<li>Fixed: Typos in Account &gt; Privacy tab texts related to Download/Erase the user data.</li>
<li>Fixed: Some typos in the fields&#8217; labels.</li>
<li>Fixed: &#8220;false&#8221; display name in the member directory. It displays empty for now if the user hasn&#8217;t display name.</li>
<li>Fixed: <code>UM()-&gt;clean_array()</code> function.</li>
<li>Fixed: LinkedIn field URL. Added ability to display the organization URL.</li>
<li>Fixed: Canonical link of the user profile if WPML plugin is active.</li>
<li>Fixed: Replacing placeholders in nav menus. Used an earlier hook for filtering items before generating HTML and avoided issues with raw, not-escaped HTML inside tags&#8217; attributes.</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>
<p>Templates required update:</p>
<ul>
<li>members-grid.php</li>
<li>members-list.php</li>
<li>password-reset.php</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>
<p>Cached and optimized/minified assets(JS/CSS) must be flushed/re-generated after upgrade</p>
</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.2.5: September 22, 2021</h4>
<ul>
<li>
<p>Enhancements:</p>
<ul>
<li>Added: Ability to insert SoundCloud track URL instead of Track ID</li>
<li>Added: Settings for the password min/max length (Ultimate Member &gt; Settings &gt; Users)</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>
<p>Bugfixes:</p>
<ul>
<li>Fixed: Invalid role keys on the role list-table + role edit screen (case when latin symbols used with not UTF-8 symbols)</li>
<li>Fixed: Restriction logic and archive lists (+ nav menu bar) with active &#8220;Disable pre-queries for restriction content logic&#8221; option</li>
<li>Fixed: Restriction settings fields conditions on wp-admin screens</li>
<li>Fixed: Account <code>user_login</code> field validation removed as redundant. The field is disabled and not used in code flow</li>
<li>Fixed: <code>display_name</code> data update after First + Last name fields edition on the Account page</li>
<li>Fixed: Password length validation on the Account page and Password Reset page</li>
<li>Fixed: Using custom fields from multi-select dropdowns for user&#8217;s <code>Display Name</code>. Unserialized custom field&#8217;s values</li>
</ul>
</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.2.4: August 27, 2021</h4>
<ul>
<li>
<p>Bugfixes:</p>
<ul>
<li>Fixed: Hiding comments feed for pages with active comments</li>
<li>Fixed: Changing the post title to the restricted value while displaying in the loop that uses direct <code>post_title</code> variable</li>
<li>Fixed: PHP errors related to not passed function attributes from 3rd-party plugins or themes when using WP native hooks</li>
<li>Fixed: Handling the login form errors via \WP_Error</li>
</ul>
</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.2.3: August 25, 2021</h4>
<ul>
<li>
<p>Enhancements:</p>
<ul>
<li>Added: &#8216;um_ignore_restricted_title&#8217; hook for workaround show post title of the restricted post</li>
<li>Added: Disable pre-queries for restriction content logic (&#8216;disable_restriction_pre_queries&#8217;) option for backward compatibility with business logic where 404 error for restricted content isn&#8217;t a good way</li>
<li>Added: Replace the restricted Post Title (&#8216;restricted_post_title_replace&#8217;) option for ability to disable restricted post&#8217;s title replace</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>
<p>Bugfixes:</p>
<ul>
<li>Fixed: <code>pre_get_terms</code> callback to avoid the conflicts with other terms queries</li>
<li>Fixed: Terms query and global access settings on PHP8 installations</li>
<li>Fixed: Member directory dropdown filters where options contain <code>&amp;</code> symbol</li>
<li>Fixed: Displaying 404 error for the restricted Media</li>
<li>Fixed: Displaying &#8216;Login as this user&#8217; action on the user profile</li>
<li>Fixed: Sanitizing of the social links fields (e.g. Twitter, Facebook, etc.)</li>
<li>Fixed: Visibility of a restricted taxonomy page in the nav menu</li>
<li>Fixed: Sanitizing key for the drag&amp;drop action</li>
<li>Fixed: Sanitizing the description field with allowed HTML inside</li>
<li>Fixed: The &#8220;Assignment to constant variable&#8221; JS error on some sites</li>
<li>Fixed: Keep description formatting in a view mode</li>
<li>Fixed: Profile form nonce handling, security enhancement</li>
<li>Fixed: `um_edit_profile_url()&#8220; function and added $user_id attribute</li>
<li>Optimized: Restriction content handlers, avoid queries duplicates or unnecessary queries</li>
</ul>
</li>
</ul>

<h4>2.1.17: April 14, 2021</h4>
<ul>

<li>Added: &#8216;Owner and specific roles&#8217; privacy type for the Profile tabs (#773)</li>

<li>Added: Hooks for integration member directory filters with different conditions for query to DB</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>
<p>Bugfixes:</p>
<ul>

<li>Fixed: PHP notice when the admin filtering field has the not array default value (e.g. bool)</li>
<li>Fixed: The conflict with <a href="https://wordpress.org/plugins/disable-blog/">Disable Blog</a> plugin regarding this <a href="https://wordpress.org/support/topic/ultimate-member-file-image-download/">issue</a>. <code>download_routing</code> callback has the highest priority now.</li>
<li>Fixed: Fields privacy functionality. This function <code>um_can_view_field()</code> has been rewritten (#780)</li>
<li>Fixed: Fields privacy + form validation functionality. Skip the field&#8217;s validation that aren&#8217;t visible on the form based on the privacy settings (#795)</li>
<li>Fixed: PHP notice in the confirm password label <a href="https://wordpress.org/support/topic/undefined-index-label-php-notice/">wp.org thread</a></li>
<li>Fixed: Confirm password placeholder when label is empty</li>
<li>Fixed: Permanently deleting form&#8217;s field (#786)</li>
<li>Fixed: Default value with comma for checkbox field-type (#729)</li>
<li>Fixed: Gutenberg blocks conditional settings (#793)</li>
<li>Fixed: Getting active Profile tab when some of them are hidden</li>
<li>Fixed: Restricted content message is showing twice and removing header, avoid the conflicts with themes that use &#8216;the_content&#8217; filter in header or footer (#799)</li>
<li>Fixed: &#8220;Is required&#8221; validation for the multiselect field-type when it&#8217;s empty on submit</li>
<li>Fixed: Using &#8216;wp_login_failed&#8217; hook, added 2nd parameter required since WordPress 5.4 version (#810)</li>
</ul>
</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.1.16: March 10, 2021</h4>
<ul>
<li>
<p>Enhancements:</p>
<ul>

</ul>

<li>Fixed: Using &#8216;manage_options&#8217; capability instead of &#8216;delete_users&#8217; for switching between members</li>
<li>Fixed: Using myCRED points metakeys in UM usermeta table</li>

<li>Fixed: Member Directory slider filter with NaN or decimal range</li>
<li>Fixed: PHP notices and warnings</li>
<li>Fixed: Security vulnerability with User Account page and password field</li>
<li>Fixed: User creating without username but based on first+last name with not-ASCII symbols</li>
<li>Fixed: Password reset hash generating more than 1 time</li>
<li>Fixed: Random order type translation string on the member directory</li>
<li>Fixed: Resize and compress images when uploading on User Profile images fields or user wall</li>
<li>Fixed: Displaying more than 1 UM popups on the same page</li>
<li>Fixed: UM dropdown.js position calculation</li>
<li>Fixed: Select2 dropdown block position calculation</li>
</ul>
</li>

<h4>2.1.13: December 8, 2020</h4>
<ul>
<li>
<p>Enhancements:</p>
<ul>
<li>Added: <code>um_member_directory_cover_image_size</code> hook with ability to change the cover photo size on the member directory</li>
<li>Added: <code>um_member_directory_avatar_image_size</code> hook with ability to change the profile photo size on the member directory</li>
<li>Added: <code>um_member_directory_get_members_allow</code> JS hook for 3rd-party integration with the member directory. You could use a time throttle until some data is loaded</li>
<li>Added: Notice about the fields&#8217; conditional logic rules + small CSS enhancements</li>
<li>Added: Invalid nonce validation on Login and Registration pages instead of wp_die()</li>
<li>Added: Privacy settings for the Divider field type (#688)</li>
<li>Added: Ability for the integration with Gutenberg Block restriction settings (extends the block restriction settings via 3rd-party plugins)</li>
<li>Added: Strings translations</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>
<p>Bugfixes:</p>
<ul>
<li>Fixed: Upgrade process on websites where a hosting locks the frequent AJAX requests (added default JS throttle between requests)</li>
<li>Fixed: Getting page content of the GDPR privacy policies</li>
<li>Fixed: Password strength validation for Unicode symbols</li>
<li>Fixed: Issue with apostrophe options in the multiselect/checkbox fields (#689)</li>
<li>Fixed: Translation for Password field&#8217;s label</li>
<li>Fixed: Download Personal Data URL</li>
<li>Fixed: Vulnerability with timestamp field on UM Forms (the hidden field with name=&#8217;timestamp&#8217; is deprecated)</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>
<p>Tweaks:</p>
<ul>
<li>There are changed PHP‚Äôs intval(), strval(), floatval(), and boolval() typecasting functions to (int), (string), (float) and (bool) regarding <a href="https://make.wordpress.org/core/2020/11/20/miscellaneous-developer-focused-changes-in-wordpress-5-6/" rel="nofollow ugc">this doc</a>.</li>
</ul>
</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.1.12: October 29, 2020</h4>

<li>Fixed conflict with other plugins with user &#8216;status&#8217; in admin</li>

<li>Fixed member directory admin filtering by the field with uppercase in &#8216;key&#8217;</li>
<li>Fixed member directory sorting by the full name</li>
<li>Fixed registration form with not editable role field</li>
<li>Fixed PHP notice for the filter without field&#8217;s label</li>
<li>Fixed PHP notice on Admin_Form class initialization</li>
<li>Fixed style of the textarea field</li>
<li>Fixed Confirm Password field&#8217;s placeholder</li>

<li>Fixed account submission when change a password</li>

<li>Fixed member directory roles in query (the case when selected some roles, but current user can see another only)</li>
<li>Fixed member directory sorting</li>
<li>Fixed member directory list dropdown init after changing view type</li>
<li>Fixed member directory admin filtering by the &#8216;user_registered&#8217; field</li>
<li>Fixed validation when using HTML in textarea</li>
<li>Fixed cleaning user old uploads</li>
<li>Fixed conditional logic for file/image-type fields</li>
<li>Fixed &#8220;get_profile_photo_size&#8221; function (avoid PHP notice with array_combine)</li>
<li>Fixed password reset/change form when other forms are initialized at the same page</li>
<li>Fixed getting extension updates on multisites</li>
<li>Fixed the &#8216;wp_authenticate_user&#8217; filter&#8217;s variables (changed username string to WP_User object)</li>
<li>Fixed SEO link canonical for the profile page</li>
<li>Fixed displaying error &amp; notice when the text is empty</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>
<p>Deprecated:</p>
<ul>

<li>Fixed is_selected function for dropdown/multi-select/checkbox profile fields</li>
<li>Fixed disable email field at Edit Profile form via filter (disabled by default)</li>
</ul>
</li>
</ul>

<h4>1.3.73: November 17, 2016</h4>
<ul>
<li>
<p>Enhancements:</p>
<ul>
<li>Adds a filter hook to modify the submitted details on registration process
<ul>
<li><code>um_before_save_filter_submitted</code></li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>Adds a filter hook to disable canonical link in header
<ul>
<li><code>um_allow_canonical__filter</code></li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>Adds a filter hook to modify the auto-generated email address on registration process
<ul>
<li><code>um_user_register_submitted__email</code></li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>Adds filter hooks to modify locale, language file path and textdomain
<ul>
<li><code>um_language_textdomain</code></li>
<li><code>um_language_locale</code></li>
<li><code>um_language_file</code></li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>Adds filter hook to modify the data of selected value:
<ul>
<li><code>um_is_selected_filter_data</code></li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>Adds new select/multi-select options to retrieve options from a callback.
<ul>
<li>In the form builder, edit or add a select/multi-select field and add your callback function in <code>Choices callback</code> field to get populated.</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>Adds parent select field option to dynamically populate another select field.
<ul>
<li>If <code>Choices Callback</code> option is set in the field settings,  the <code>Parent Option</code> triggers an Ajax request to populate the child options on <code>change</code> event.</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>Updates <code>um.min.js</code> file.</li>
<li>Updates <code>en_US</code> translation file.</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>
<p>Bugfixes:</p>
<ul>
<li>Removes notices from WPCLI console.</li>
<li>Removes notices from edit profile mode</li>
<li>Removes autocomplete from search filter fields</li>
<li>Fix translation strings of search filters on a member directory</li>
<li>Fix email notifications not sending on registration process</li>
<li>Fix field selection with special characters on form submission</li>
<li>Fix assigning of role on register submission process</li>
</ul>
</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.3.72: October 10, 2016</h4>
<ul>
<li>
<p>Enhancements:</p>
<ul>

<li><code>um_image_handle_{$field}__option</code></li>
</ul>
</li>

<li>

<ul>
<li>Fixes a bug where multi-select field options doesn&#8217;t match the user selected options that contain html entities.</li>
<li>Fixes a bug to display correct role slugs in radio and select fields.</li>
<li>Fixes a bug where reset password form is conflicting with register and login form on a page.</li>
<li>Fixes a bug where Users queue count in the Admin &gt; <code>All Users / Users</code> menu doesn&#8217;t update when a user account is in <code>pending user review</code> and gets deleted.</li>
<li>Fixes a typo in Password Reset Email option&#8217;s description</li>
<li>Fixes a bug where conditional fields &#8216;equals to&#8217; validation on registration process</li>
<li>Fixes a bug to disable the query with hiding account on member directory</li>
<li>Fixes a bug to retrieve specific number of members </li>
<li>Fixes a bug to retrieve all members with <code>get_members</code> new parameter <code>number</code></li>
<li>Fixes a typo in Welcome Email template.</li>
<li>Fixes a bug where login form redirection is set to <code>wp-admin/admin-ajax.php</code> instead of the current page when loaded via ajax.</li>
<li>Fixes a bug where uninstall link doesn&#8217;t load.</li>
<li>Fixes a bug to redirect users to correct URL after login based from login options.</li>
<li>Fixes a bug where non-logged in users are not able to access the profile page when <code>Global Site Access</code> is set to <code>Site accessible to Logged In Users</code>.</li>
<li>Fixes a bug to modify the login redirection url especially when DOING_AJAX is defined.</li>
<li>Fixes a bug to retrieve correct community roles per site in a Multisite Network setup.</li>
</ul>
</li>

<h4>1.3.69: September 08, 2016</h4>
<ul>
<li>
<p>Enhancements:</p>
<ul>
<li>Adds a system information tool for support purposes</li>
<li>Adds a new option to disable generating profile slugs on every load of member directory pages.
<ul>
<li>Located in UM &gt; Settings &gt; Advanced &gt; Stop generating profile slugs in member directory.</li>
<li>This improves the performance when loading profiles in directories. It generates profile slug on Profile Update ( front and back-end ), Registration Process and viewing the Users in the back-end.</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>Adds new filter hook <code>um_activate_url</code> to modify the account activation url.</li>
<li>Adds new filter hooks to modify first and last name cases
<ul>
<li><code>um_user_first_name_case</code> </li>
<li><code>um_user_last_name_case</code></li>
</ul>
</li>

<li>New: security improvement: added whitelisted IP(s) option to allow you to access the WP-admin screen always (prevents lockout)</li>
<li>New: added filter hook um_whitelisted_wpadmin_access to control access to wp-admin login screens (for developers)</li>
<li>New: added custom css option to apply extra css styling rules from plugin settings</li>
<li>New: added custom css option to each form allowing you to apply extra styling rules per form</li>
<li>New: added option to customize profile fields area width (per form basis) besides global option</li>
<li>Tweak: compatibility with default permalinks (Pretty permalinks are strongly recommended though!)</li>
<li>Tweak: improved the function that gets user IP address</li>
<li>Tweak: performance: inline css from the plugin is automatically compressed/minified</li>
</ul>

<ul>
<li>Fixed: Issue with drag and drop form builder</li>
<li>Fixed: Form builder trash icon in backend</li>
<li>Fixed: Minor css adjustments in frontend</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.0.17: January 22, 2015</h4>
<ul>
<li>New: WordPress Multi-site compatibility for user uploads and photos</li>
<li>Fixed: Searching members by username or email in directory (partial search supported)</li>
<li>Fixed: Anonymous tracking</li>
<li>Fixed: Minor css fixes</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.0.16: January 22, 2015</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fixed: Settings page: tracking popup removed</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.0.15: January 22, 2015</h4>
<ul>
<li>New: User profiles now show a cool message if the user profile field area is empty</li>
<li>New: Added &#8216;visibility&#8217; setting to all field types in backend</li>
<li>Tweak: Members search function supports partial search matching</li>
<li>Tweak: Deleting photo or file removes file from server</li>
<li>Tweak: Deleting a user will delete all his personal uploads from the server</li>
<li>Fixed: Duplicate tooltip for password field has been removed</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.0.10: January 22, 2015</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fixed: Template tags for welcome e-mail</li>
<li>Fixed: {submitted_registration} e-mail template tag</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.0.0: January, 2015</h4>
<ul>
<li>First official release!</li>
</ul>
